bibl.title: Letter from Vernon W. Lippard to Philip Showalter Hench, February 9, 1953

div1.p: Lippard informs Hench that he is sending the information about the Camp Lazear dedication to Hunter, his successor at the University of Virginia. He is suggesting that the material be used for the next Medical Alumni News Letter and then placed in the library.

div1.head: Letter from Vernon W. Lippard to Philip Showalter Hench, February 9, 1953
div1.opener:
YALE UNIVERSITY SCHOOL OF MEDICINE
333 CEDAR STREET · NEW HAVEN II · CONNECTICUT
February 9, 1953
OFFICE OF THE DEAN
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you for your letter of January 17th and all the inter-
esting information on the dedication of Camp Lazear. It must have
been a most interesting experience, and I only wish I could have
shared it with you.

I am forwarding the entire file to my successor at the Uni-
versity of Virginia, Tom Hunter, who will want to study it as part
of his education for the deanship there, with the suggestion that
after material has been extracted for the next number of the Medi-
cal Alumni News Letter, it be deposited in the Alderman Library.
I shall also remind him that the University owes you not only
$15.00 for the wreath but a debt of gratitude for including it in
the ceremony.

I saw your son a few days ago, and he seems to be enjoying
himself. I hope to become better acquainted with him later.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Vernon W. Lippard, M.D.
Dean cc: Dr. Hunter
